verbose_text: Kariz and Petrovic showed a higher risk for myocardial infarction (MI) for a genotype with reduced levels of VEGFR2 (i.e., G/G of rs2071559 A> G) and others have suggested that the reduced expression of VEGFR2 is associated with a higher risk profile for CVD, which is in line with the observation in the present study of reduced expression of VEGFR2 under non uniform shear stress conditions.
